65ca5e3b-26f5-4e15-8d84-043169b8c8a6: A bloodrager's land {g|Encyclopedia:Speed}speed{/g} is faster than is normal for his {g|Encyclopedia:Race}race{/g} by 10 feet. This benefit applies only when he is wearing no armor, light armor, or medium armor, and not carrying a heavy load. Apply this {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} before modifying the bloodrager's speed due to any armor worn or load carried. This bonus stacks with any other bonuses to the bloodrager's land speed.
a8d06168-db74-4268-9d00-fcf074901a54: A corrosive burst weapon functions as a corrosive weapon that also explodes with acid upon striking a successful {g|Encyclopedia:Critical}critical hit{/g}. The acid does not harm the wielder. In addition to the extra {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d6{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Energy_Damage}acid damage{/g} from the corrosive ability, a corrosive burst weapon deals an extra 1d10 points of acid damage on a successful critical hit. If the weapon's critical multiplier is ×3, add an extra 2d10 points of acid damage instead, and if the multiplier is ×4, add an extra 3d10 points of acid damage.
c33b63a4-7ffc-491a-9cba-ddc219a1fc15: A flaming burst weapon functions as a flaming weapon that also explodes with flame upon striking a successful {g|Encyclopedia:Critical}critical hit{/g}. The fire does not harm the wielder. In addition to the extra {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d6{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Energy_Damage}fire damage{/g} from the flaming ability, a flaming burst weapon deals an extra 1d10 points of fire damage on a successful critical hit. If the weapon's critical multiplier is ×3, add an extra 2d10 points of fire damage instead, and if the multiplier is ×4, add an extra 3d10 points of fire damage.
5536aa5b-19be-476c-8185-37ace09792af:
A hag-riven grows claws that are treated as {g|Encyclopedia:NaturalAttack}natural weapons{/g}. These claws are primary {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attacks{/g} and deal {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d4{/g} points of {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} each (1d3 for a {g|Encyclopedia:Size}Small{/g} creature). At 2nd level, these claws are considered magic weapons for the purpose of overcoming {g|Encyclopedia:Damage_Reduction}damage reduction{/g}. At 5th level, the damage increases to 1d6 points (1d4 for a Small creature). At 9th level, the hag-riven gains the rend ability with her claw attacks. At 13th level, the hag-riven's claws threaten a {g|Encyclopedia:Critical}critical hit{/g} on a natural roll of 19–20. At 17th level, the damage increases again to 1d8 points (1d6 for a Small creature) and the hag-riven's successful attacks with the claws inflict weakness on enemies.
Weakness: Whenever the hag-riven hits a foe with her claw attack, the victim takes 1d4 points of {g|Encyclopedia:Strength}Strength{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:AbilityDamage}damage{/g} unless it succeeds on a {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}Fortitude save{/g} ({g|Encyclopedia:DC}DC{/g} = 10 + half the hag-riven's level + her {g|Encyclopedia:Constitution}Constitution{/g} modifier).
a459fc2d-ee5b-4dc7-96a8-3b9a03e3223e: A mixed-blood rager can use his strange heritage to invoke powers of different bloodlines. Once per day, he can choose a bloodline: until the next time he chooses a bloodline, he gains all the advantages of the chosen bloodline.
fec5a873-01a7-4d35-bb03-64aedae2a303: A shocking burst weapon functions as a shock weapon that explodes with electricity upon striking a successful {g|Encyclopedia:Critical}critical hit{/g}. The electricity does not harm the wielder. In addition to the extra {g|Encyclopedia:Energy_Damage}electricity damage{/g} from the shock ability, a shocking burst weapon deals an extra {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d10{/g} points of electricity damage on a successful critical hit. If the weapon's critical multiplier is ×3, add an extra 2d10 points of electricity damage instead, and if the multiplier is ×4, add an extra 3d10 points.
3e2d3997-81f4-44c2-847a-9f310d993515: A steelblood gains proficiency in heavy armor. A steelblood can cast bloodrager {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spells{/g} while wearing heavy armor without incurring an {g|Encyclopedia:Spell_Fail_Chance}arcane spell failure chance{/g}.
f7639f48-7923-48e6-9dbc-b0c4b464ef5d: A {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spelleater{/g}'s blood empowers him to slowly recover from his wounds. At 2nd level, while bloodraging a spelleater gains {g|Encyclopedia:Fast_Healing}fast healing{/g} 1. At 7th level and every 3 levels thereafter, this increases by 1 (to a maximum of fast healing 6 at 19th level).
8914b255-fc01-4c7c-ad83-fecadcbc50d6: Ability doubles the {g|Encyclopedia:Critical}threat range{/g} of a weapon. This benefit doesn't stack with any other effects that expand the threat range of a weapon.
fc26e63f-4b52-4a4f-a705-e53be8ecbbe3: An anarchic weapon is infused with the power of chaos. It makes the weapon {g|Encyclopedia:Alignment}chaotically aligned{/g} and thus bypasses the corresponding {g|Encyclopedia:Damage_Reduction}damage reduction{/g}. It deals an extra {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}2d6{/g} points of {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} against all creatures of lawful alignment.
7d065eff-5f18-4dc7-8940-198ec3ab7400: An icy burst weapon functions as a frost weapon that also explodes with frost upon striking a successful {g|Encyclopedia:Critical}critical hit{/g}. The frost does not harm the wielder. In addition to the extra {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} from the frost ability, an icy burst weapon deals an extra {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d10{/g} points of {g|Encyclopedia:Energy_Damage}cold damage{/g} on a successful critical hit. If the weapon's critical multiplier is ×3, add an extra 2d10 points of cold damage instead, and if the multiplier is ×4, add an extra 3d10 points.
3c26c408-1af7-44a5-890d-6bb77176ce6d: An unholy weapon is imbued with unholy power. This power makes the weapon {g|Encyclopedia:Alignment}evil-aligned{/g} and thus bypasses the corresponding {g|Encyclopedia:Damage_Reduction}damage reduction{/g}. It deals an extra {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}2d6{/g} points of {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} against all creatures of good alignment.
e2361a0d-bb5c-404f-88ac-de3b6fac27e1: At 10th level, a hag-riven gains Critical Focus as a bonus {g|Encyclopedia:Feat}feat{/g}, but she can apply its benefits only to her claw {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attacks{/g}. One per day, she can select a single feat with Critical Focus as a prerequisite and apply its benefits to her claw attacks. This does not count as meeting the prerequisites for taking feats normally.
919c2d14-4be3-49f9-b1fe-9114fba17822: At 11th level, all of the reformed fiend's {g|Encyclopedia:MeleeAttack}melee attacks{/g} become {g|Encyclopedia:Alignment}good-aligned{/g}.
ead350f7-c74f-4466-bd7e-8ed3b6a1dec3:
At 11th level, when a bloodrager enters a bloodrage, the {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} to his {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack{/g} and {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage rolls{/g} increases to +3 and the morale bonus on his {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}Will saves{/g} increases to +3. In addition, upon entering a bloodrage, the bloodrager can cast a bloodrager {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g} he knows of 2nd level or lower as a {g|Encyclopedia:Swift_Action}swift action{/g}. The spell must have a "Touch" or "Self" range. This use consumes a bloodrager spell slot, as if he had cast the spell; he must have the spell slot available to take advantage of this effect.
Greater bloodrage counts as the barbarian's greater rage ability for the purposes of {g|Encyclopedia:Feat}feat{/g} prerequisites, feat abilities, magic item abilities, and spell effects.
999616bc-aa47-4b1c-966d-40b20ba67b0f: At 12th level, as a {g|Encyclopedia:Swift_Action}swift action{/g} once per bloodrage you can empower your {g|Encyclopedia:MeleeAttack}melee attacks{/g} with fear. For 1 {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}round{/g}, creatures you hit with your melee attacks become {g|ConditionShaken}shaken{/g}. Creatures who are already shaken become {g|ConditionFrightened}frightened{/g}. This is a mind-affecting fear effect.
825c0a6f-ea3d-41af-b61f-6f961b07b7c1: At 12th level, when entering a bloodrage you sprout bat-like wings from your back.
7ab02f54-4a73-4809-9c99-d369d5d9fe73: At 12th level, when entering a bloodrage, you grow leathery wings from your back.
27543930-286d-4718-98e5-cae4186bcef5: At 12th level, while bloodraging you're treated as if you are under the effects of {g|SpellsHaste}haste{/g}.
a3527f01-b1e8-441c-b84d-26514783a5ac: At 12th level, you gain an ability to disrupt enemy casting around you. All enemy casters in 10 feet of you have to make a {g|Encyclopedia:Concentration}concentration check{/g} to cast a {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g} with a {g|Encyclopedia:DC}difficulty{/g} 15 + double spell level. You have this ability constantly, even while not bloodraging.
8bc60892-f839-4b74-84f7-41a2f4258751: At 12th level, you sprout feathery wings during bloodrage.
c00b5958-cdca-4deb-80b4-84843a169005:
At 12th level, your form grows more twisted and powerful while bloodraging, but clumsy, blind aggression clouds your mind. You become more akin to an annis hag, gaining a +2 racial {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} on {g|Encyclopedia:Persuasion}Persuasion{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Skills}skill checks{/g} made to intimidate. Your bonus on {g|Encyclopedia:MeleeAttack}melee attack{/g} rolls, melee {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage rolls{/g}, and thrown weapon damage rolls increases by 1, and you gain the {g|Encyclopedia:Scent}scent{/g} ability, but you take a -2 {g|Encyclopedia:Penalty}penalty{/g} to both {g|Encyclopedia:Dexterity}Dexterity{/g} and {g|Encyclopedia:Wisdom}Wisdom{/g} for the duration of your bloodrage.
At 16th level, you apply your bonus on {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}Will saving throws{/g} while bloodraging to Fortitude and Reflex saving throws.
bd8024f2-ad60-4e37-b074-0dafa6cbaa60: At 12th level, your {g|Encyclopedia:Reach}reach{/g} increases by 5 feet during bloodrage.
66e07c96-0f8f-492a-b271-8fd5fb6aee7d: At 12th level, {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} to {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack{/g} and {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage rolls{/g} granted by your bloodrage increases by 1, but the {g|Encyclopedia:Penalty}penalty{/g} to {g|Encyclopedia:Armor_Class}AC{/g} becomes –4 instead of –2. At 16th level, this bonus increases by 2 instead. At 20th level, it increases by 3 instead.
2f6e8570-24e1-4a2f-8358-b28b3579251e: At 12th level, {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} of your elemental strikes increases to {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}2d6{/g}, and {g|Encyclopedia:DC}DC{/g} of {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spells{/g} with your elemental {g|Encyclopedia:Spell_Descriptor}descriptor{/g} increases by 2.
e6ab3889-7d99-4f5b-82e4-bd3864c96b3a: At 14th level, a bloodrager gains a +4 {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} on {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}Will saves{/g} to {g|Encyclopedia:Spell_Resistance}resist Enchantment spells{/g} while bloodraging. This bonus stacks with all other modifiers, including the morale bonus on Will saves he also receives during his bloodrage.
939c7f13-a452-4096-8c67-5800b10c6b1d: At 16th level, enemy creatures of the animal or plant types who come in a 15-foot area around you have to make a {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}Will saving throw{/g} ({g|Encyclopedia:DC}DC{/g} 10 + half your bloodrager level + {g|Encyclopedia:Charisma}Charisma{/g} modifier) or become fascinated. This ability is active even while you are not bloodraging.
fbeb7cc1-c523-4823-9094-3afaf4b7f253: At 16th level, once per bloodrage, you can turn into a Hydra as a {g|Encyclopedia:Free_Action}free action{/g}. You gain a +4 {g|Encyclopedia:Size}size{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} to {g|Encyclopedia:Strength}Strength{/g}, a +2 size bonus to {g|Encyclopedia:Constitution}Constitution{/g}, a +4 natural armor bonus to {g|Encyclopedia:Armor_Class}AC{/g}, immunity to trip, and five bite {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attacks{/g} ({g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d8{/g}). The poison from serpentine fangs applies to bite attacks in hydra form.
4233a831-6cec-44c8-a645-c47b55ec3fbb: At 16th level, once per day when entering a bloodrage you can take an elemental form as {g|SpellsElementalBodyIV}elemental body IV{/g}.
b90314ad-3933-4f90-8721-39d42019cdd4: At 16th level, once per day you can choose to become incorporeal. You take only half {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} from magic corporeal sources, and you take no damage from non-magic weapons and objects.
66ad854c-a266-4ed6-8bf3-ba77ee267ca8: At 16th level, when entering a bloodrage you can choose one of the following {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spells{/g} and apply its effects to yourself: {g|SpellsBeastShapeIV}beast shape IV{/g}, {g|SpellsDragonkindI}dragonkind I{/g}, or {g|SpellsTransformation}transformation{/g}. This is in addition to arcane bloodrage and greater arcane bloodrage, and otherwise works as those abilities.
8702dfea-af11-4d7c-9f06-8a194929142f: At 16th level, when entering a bloodrage you can choose to exude an aura of fire. The aura is a 5-foot burst centered on you, and deals ({g|Encyclopedia:Dice}2d6{/g} + your {g|Encyclopedia:Constitution}Constitution{/g} modifier) points of {g|Encyclopedia:Energy_Damage}fire damage{/g} to creatures that end their turns within it.
a9854822-4f7a-4840-9c18-0081a2639a0b: At 16th level, when entering a bloodrage, you can choose to take the form of your chosen dragon type (as {g|SpellsDragonkindII}dragonkind II{/g}).
37364d78-99c8-4c85-a39e-24e4dbe188ee: At 16th level, when you charge the {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack{/g} you make at the end of the charge deals additional {g|Encyclopedia:Energy_Damage}fire damage{/g} equal {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d6{/g} per four bloodrager levels you have.
fa9d044b-79cc-4105-b01e-f58a63f2ebf2: At 16th level, you can cast {g|SpellsBestowCurse}bestow curse{/g} three times per day as a {g|Encyclopedia:Special_Abilities}spell-like ability{/g}.
9acb16c9-5d25-455c-b72a-4a1f3a38a6fa: At 16th level, you gain a +4 deflection {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} to {g|Encyclopedia:Armor_Class}AC{/g} and a +4 resistance bonus on {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}saving throws{/g} against {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attacks{/g} made or effects created by {g|Encyclopedia:Alignment}evil{/g} creatures.
81146a0d-ce09-411a-843f-707f731c46a6: At 17th level, a bloodrager no longer becomes {g|ConditionFatigued}fatigued{/g} at the end of his bloodrage.
2cd8d6bd-de39-4e09-8cb7-b1467b1ff0d3: At 1st level, a steelblood gains a +1 {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} on {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Maneuvers}combat maneuver{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Check}checks{/g}, to {g|Encyclopedia:CMD}CMD{/g} against overrun combat maneuvers. He also gains a +1 bonus to his {g|Encyclopedia:Armor_Class}AC{/g} against charge {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attacks{/g} and on attack and {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage rolls{/g} against charging creatures.
efc3d971-62bd-47cd-9d4a-80dc1b570de5: At 1st level, as a {g|Encyclopedia:Swift_Action}swift action{/g} up to three times a day you can infuse your {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attacks{/g} with hellfire. When you do, your {g|Encyclopedia:MeleeAttack}melee attacks{/g} gain the flaming weapon special ability for 1 {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}round{/g}. At 12th level, you can use this ability five times per day, and the effect is treated as flaming burst.
3f86bc3f-7759-4755-b700-70e6866581b9: At 1st level, enemies within 10 feet of you have -2 {g|Encyclopedia:Penalty}penalty{/g} on {g|Encyclopedia:Concentration}concentration checks{/g}. This increase stacks with that granted by the Disruptive {g|Encyclopedia:Feat}feat{/g}.
ef8207fd-e49e-4ea7-b56c-41a007f463d7: At 1st level, fey power courses through your {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attacks{/g}. Each time you confirm a {g|Encyclopedia:Critical}critical hit{/g}, the target must succeed at a {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}Will saving throw{/g} or be {g|ConditionConfusion}confused{/g} for 1 {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}round{/g}. The {g|Encyclopedia:DC}DC{/g} of this save is equal to 10 + half your bloodrager level + your {g|Encyclopedia:Constitution}Constitution{/g} modifier. This is a mind-affecting compulsion effect.
c5a00f7f-406d-4c95-8077-bdfbff86831d: At 1st level, three times a day as a {g|Encyclopedia:Swift_Action}swift action{/g} you can imbue your {g|Encyclopedia:MeleeAttack}melee attacks{/g} with elemental energy. For 1 {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}round{/g}, your melee attacks deal {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d6{/g} points of additional {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} of your energy type. At 8th level, you can use this ability up to five times per day. At 20th level, all your melee attacks deal this damage, and this ability no longer requires a swift {g|Encyclopedia:CA_Types}action{/g} to activate.
e672e04d-3ce4-4a68-9379-a7229ccac642: At 1st level, when you hit a creature with a charge {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack{/g}, that creature becomes {g|ConditionShaken}shaken{/g} for a number of {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}rounds{/g} equal to 1/2 your bloodrager level (minimum 1). This effect does not cause an existing shaken or {g|ConditionFrightened}frightened{/g} condition (from this ability or another source) to turn into frightened or panicked. This is a mind-affecting fear effect.
e366fd37-c3b6-41d0-ad9e-956953f3fd21: At 1st level, you can curse an opponent with a wicked glance. As a {g|Encyclopedia:Standard_Actions}standard action{/g}, you can afflict one target within 30 feet that you can see, causing it to take a -2 {g|Encyclopedia:Penalty}penalty{/g} to {g|Encyclopedia:Armor_Class}AC{/g} and on {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack rolls{/g} for 1 {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}round{/g} per {g|Encyclopedia:Class_Level}class level{/g}. A {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}Will save{/g} reduces this to just 1 round ({g|Encyclopedia:DC}DC{/g} = 10 + half your bloodrager level + your {g|Encyclopedia:Charisma}Charisma{/g} modifier). You can use this ability a number of times per day equal to 3 + your Charisma modifier. At 8th level, the penalty increases to -4.
44644ce9-7e41-46a1-8131-317df25df011: At 1st level, you gain a bite {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack{/g} dealing {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d8{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} (1d6 for {g|Encyclopedia:Size}small{/g} creatures). Additionally, it can apply a poison, dealing 1 {g|Encyclopedia:Constitution}Constitution{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:AbilityDamage}damage{/g} per {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}round{/g} for 4 rounds. The {g|Encyclopedia:DC}DC{/g} is equal to 10 + half your bloodrager level + Constitution modifier. At 8th level, the damage increases to 1d2 Constitution damage and the duration increases to 5 rounds. At 16th level, the damage increases to 1d4 Constitution damage and the duration increases to 6 rounds. Additionally, the number of {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}saves{/g} needed to cure from the poison increases to 2.
0f748dc4-7ac1-4b05-8c8c-36db897ff6a8: At 1st level, you grow claws while bloodraging. These claws are treated as {g|Encyclopedia:NaturalAttack}natural weapons{/g}, allowing you to make two claw {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attacks{/g} as a full attack, using your full {g|Encyclopedia:BAB}base attack bonus{/g}. These attacks deal {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d6{/g} points of {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} each (1d4 if you are Small) plus your {g|Encyclopedia:Strength}Strength{/g} modifier. At 4th level, these claws are considered magic weapons for the purpose of overcoming damage resistance. At 8th level, the damage increases to 1d8 points (1d6 if you are Small). At 12th level, these claws become flaming weapons, which deal an additional 1d6 points of {g|Encyclopedia:Energy_Damage}fire damage{/g} on a hit.
1c63a07e-ed26-4881-ae4e-5fc4cb975091: At 1st level, you grow claws. These claws are treated as {g|Encyclopedia:NaturalAttack}natural weapons{/g}, allowing you to make two claw {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attacks{/g} as a full attack, using your full {g|Encyclopedia:BAB}base attack bonus{/g}. These attacks deal {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d6{/g} points of {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} each (1d4 if you are Small) plus your {g|Encyclopedia:Strength}Strength{/g} modifier. At 4th level, these claws are considered magic weapons for the purpose of overcoming {g|Encyclopedia:Damage_Reduction}damage reduction{/g}. At 8th level, the damage increases to 1d8 points (1d6 if you are Small). At 12th level, these claws deal an additional 1d6 points of damage of your energy type on a hit.
329f22d3-e628-48d2-9e6e-b8fe33373cd1: At 1st level, your {g|Encyclopedia:MeleeAttack}melee attacks{/g} are considered {g|Encyclopedia:Alignment}good-aligned{/g} weapons for the purpose of bypassing {g|Encyclopedia:Damage_Reduction}damage reduction{/g}. Furthermore, when you deal {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} with a melee attack to an evil outsider, you deal an additional {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d6{/g} points of damage. This additional damage stacks with effects such as align weapon and those granted by a weapon with the holy weapon special ability.
956a1ff8-6d68-48e4-9ae2-d4c13035e0a3: At 20th level, elemental power surges through your body. You gain immunity to sneak attacks, {g|Encyclopedia:Critical}critical hits{/g}, and {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} from your energy type. You have this benefit constantly, even while not bloodraging.
38134956-9096-4b08-a26f-a2112dd30dfb: At 20th level, when a bloodrager enters a bloodrage, the morale {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} to his {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack{/g} and {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage rolls{/g} increases to +4, and the morale bonus on his {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}Will saves{/g} increases to +4. Furthermore, the {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g} he can apply to himself at the beginning of a bloodrage due to the greater bloodrage class feature is not limited to only spells of 2nd level or lower.
9a64746d-1beb-4510-a533-9036c8136b74: At 20th level, when entering a bloodrage all of your {g|Encyclopedia:MeleeAttack}melee attacks{/g} are considered to have bane enchantment. This ability doesn't stack with other forms of bane.
9a6ff969-6757-4708-98a7-eb7d17cd201e: At 20th level, you become infused with the power of the heavens. You gain {g|Encyclopedia:Energy_Immunity}immunity{/g} to acid, cold, and petrification. You also gain {g|Encyclopedia:Energy_Resistance}resistance{/g} 10 to electricity and fire, as well as a +4 racial {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} on {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}saving throws{/g} against poison. You have these benefits constantly, even while not bloodraging.
1d77dc9b-a82c-41d5-a2bf-fef6e93b1f97: At 20th level, you gain immunity to paralysis, sleep, and {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} from your energy type. You also gain {g|Encyclopedia:Blindsense}blindsense{/g} with a range of 60 feet. You have these benefits constantly, even while not bloodraging.
49b83909-9946-48bf-9b85-19a49eee4173: At 20th level, you gain immunity to poison. Additionally, you can't be caught {g|Encyclopedia:Flat_Footed}flat-footed{/g} and don't provoke {g|Encyclopedia:Attack_Of_Opportunity}attacks of opportunity{/g}. You have these benefits constantly, even while not bloodraging.
6f472f8a-de70-46bd-9f36-a4bd81e56f0a: At 20th level, you gain {g|Encyclopedia:Energy_Immunity}immunity{/g} to cold, paralysis, and sleep. The {g|Encyclopedia:Damage_Reduction}DR{/g} from your damage reduction ability increases to 8. You gain a +4 morale {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} on {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}saving throws{/g} made against {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spells{/g} and {g|Encyclopedia:Special_Abilities}spell-like abilities{/g} cast by undead. You have these benefits constantly, even while not bloodraging.
9f568a2f-df51-45d5-8832-ad02b2fbe910: At 20th level, you gain {g|Encyclopedia:Energy_Immunity}immunity{/g} to fire and poison. You also gain {g|Encyclopedia:Energy_Resistance}resistance{/g} 10 to acid and cold. You have these benefits constantly, even while not bloodraging.
4fb20c1e-a757-405d-836a-6e718f956d67: At 20th level, you gain {g|Encyclopedia:Energy_Immunity}immunity{/g} to {g|Encyclopedia:Energy_Damage}negative energy damage{/g} and all {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spells{/g} with the curse {g|Encyclopedia:Spell_Descriptor}descriptor{/g}. Whenever you confirm a {g|Encyclopedia:Critical}critical hit{/g} with a melee weapon, you can immediately target your opponent with a {g|SpellsBestowCurse}bestow curse{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Special_Abilities}spell-like ability{/g} with a random curse effect.
7c518489-cdcf-4942-af5a-0079b072dc88: At 20th level, you're {g|Encyclopedia:Energy_Immunity}immune{/g} to electricity and poison. You have this benefit constantly, even while not bloodraging.
ae627da8-6401-4d82-8d1b-c12dceb51714: At 20th level, {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spellcasters{/g} within 10 feet of you automatically fail attempts at casting defensively. You have this ability constantly, even while not bloodraging.
8fec1570-7f9b-492f-9c4c-7c5ff0c897b9: At 2nd level, a steelblood moves faster in medium and heavy armor. When wearing medium or heavy armor, a steelblood can move 5 feet faster than normal in that armor, to a maximum of his unencumbered {g|Encyclopedia:Speed}speed{/g}.
138a34da-ef6f-4719-bb0f-c665e26c6344: At 3rd level, a greenrager's fury allows him to move through undergrowth with frightening {g|Encyclopedia:Speed}speed{/g} and grace. He can move through any sort difficult terrain at his normal speed and without taking {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} or suffering any other impairment.
da666fcb-dd02-4f0c-84ae-9e19dffee3ba: At 3rd level, due to the power of his blood, a bloodrager can stand confidently amid the effects of {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spells{/g} cast by himself or his allies. He gains a +2 {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} on {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}saving throws{/g} against spells that he or an ally casts.
3c5c8a35-a04d-4c09-a369-0ed005e0a2ce: At 4th level and every 4 levels thereafter, a primalist can choose to take either his bloodline power or two barbarian rage powers. If the primalist chooses rage powers, those rage powers can be used in conjunction with his bloodrage, and his bloodrager level acts as his barbarian level when determining the effect of those bloodrage powers and any prerequisites. Any other prerequisites for a rage power must be met before a primalist can choose it. This ability does not count as the rage power class feature for determining {g|Encyclopedia:Feat}feat{/g} prerequisites and other requirements.
b1168ad7-ab94-40a5-b84d-0e7301611a06: At 4th level, when entering a bloodrage you can choose one of the following {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spells{/g} and apply its effects to yourself: {g|SpellsBlur}blur{/g}, {g|SpellsProtectionFromArrows}protection from arrows{/g}, or {g|SpellsResistEnergy}resist energy{/g} (choose one energy type).
3bd5acad-a09b-4e50-90f1-59dcdfa3fd66: At 4th level, when entering a bloodrage, you can choose to grow one {g|Encyclopedia:Size}size{/g} category larger than your base size (as {g|SpellsEnlargePerson}enlarge person{/g}) even if you aren't humanoid.
17f65b54-fed6-4761-a4f5-969bb5c4217c: At 4th level, you become immune to mundane and magical diseases. At 8th level, you also become immune to poison.
df3c2a1e-4ef5-48a0-972a-4b7b49a6e8da: At 4th level, you gain +1 natural armor {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} to {g|Encyclopedia:Armor_Class}AC{/g} and +1 bonus to {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}saving throws{/g} against poison. At 8th level and every 4 levels after, those bonuses increase by 1.
a67f1d5f-cbf4-4aaa-b73d-f75b4c227fac: At 4th level, you gain energy {g|Encyclopedia:Energy_Resistance}resistance{/g} 10 against your energy type.
2765f5e2-de5c-404c-958d-dfdd88102644: At 4th level, you gain fire {g|Encyclopedia:Energy_Resistance}resistance{/g} 5, as well as a +2 {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} on {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}saving throws{/g} against poison. At 8th level, your fire resistance increases to 10, and the bonus on saving throws against poison increases to +4.
8551d13f-3e23-4055-9bdb-310c84980f57: At 4th level, you gain resistance 5 against your energy type and a +1 natural armor {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} to {g|Encyclopedia:Armor_Class}AC{/g}. At 8th level, your energy {g|Encyclopedia:Energy_Resistance}resistance{/g} increases to 10 and your natural armor bonus to AC increases to +2. At 16th level, your natural armor bonus increases to +4.
4d6224a8-8cb8-4649-a8c2-89df7e99bea8: At 4th level, you gain {g|Encyclopedia:Energy_Resistance}resistance{/g} 5 to acid and cold. At 12th level, these resistances increase to 10.
95d94527-ee9b-49da-ad85-93c282f73995: At 4th level, you ignore difficult terrain. You can move through it at normal {g|Encyclopedia:Speed}speed{/g}, and it does not impede your charge.
746edc18-4f5a-4448-8e3a-fc6e6b53a270: At 4th level, your {g|Encyclopedia:MeleeAttack}melee attacks{/g} are treated as if they have the ghost touch weapon special ability.
836e4ca4-f6b1-4fcd-a59b-31ae7fc8bbf0:
At 5th level, a hag-riven can, as a {g|Encyclopedia:Swift_Action}swift action{/g}, grant her claws a +1 enhancement {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g}. This bonus stacks with existing enhancement bonuses (such as those provided by {g|SpellsMagicFang}magic fang{/g} or magic items) to a maximum of +5. This bonus increases to +2 at 7th level, +3 at 10th level, and +4 at 13th level.
Beginning at 7th level, the hag-riven can sacrifice one point of the bonus provided by her sorcerous claws to add any of the following weapon properties to her claws: corrosive, flaming, frost, keen, shock, or vicious.
Beginning at 10th level, the hag-riven can sacrifice two points of the bonus provided by her sorcerous claws to add any of the following weapon properties to her claws: anarchic, corrosive burst, flaming burst, icy burst, shocking burst, or unholy.
Beginning at 13th level, the hag-riven can sacrifice three points of the bonus provided by her sorcerous claws to add any of the following weapon properties to her claws: nullifying or speed.
Her claws must have a minimum enhancement bonus of +1 before any {g|Encyclopedia:Special_Abilities}special abilities{/g} can be added.
6d915ef1-326a-41d4-a30b-65be66f2c6d1: At 5th level, a reformed fiend gains a +1 {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} on {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack{/g} and {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage rolls{/g} against {g|Encyclopedia:Alignment}evil{/g} creatures while in bloodrage. This bonus increases by +1 for every 5 levels.
26536175-606f-4c1f-b889-f278e772ed19: At 5th level, a steelblood learns to be more maneuverable while wearing armor. Whenever he is wearing armor, he reduces the {g|Encyclopedia:Armor_Check_Penalty}armor check penalty{/g} by 1 (to a maximum of 0) and increases the {g|Encyclopedia:Max_Dex_Bonus}maximum Dexterity bonus{/g} allowed by his armor by 1. Every 4 levels thereafter (9th, 13th, and 17th), these {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonuses{/g} increase by 1, to a maximum 4-point reduction of the armor check {g|Encyclopedia:Penalty}penalty{/g} and a +4 increase of the maximum {g|Encyclopedia:Dexterity}Dexterity{/g} bonus. This ability stacks with the fighter class feature of the same name.
eb4f1d17-0336-4301-a6ad-55e9ca885dd0: At 5th level, a {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spelleater{/g} can consume spell slots for an extra dose of {g|Encyclopedia:Healing}healing{/g}. As a {g|Encyclopedia:Swift_Action}swift action{/g}, the spelleater can consume one unused bloodrager spell slot to heal {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d8{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} for each level of the spell slot consumed.
5c3e1140-3822-44df-9bb6-047b7f9c2d10: At 5th level, the bloodrider gains the service of a feral mount. This ability functions as the druid's animal companion, using the bloodrager's level – 4 as his effective druid level. This companion must be one he is capable of riding and suitable as a mount. Whenever a bloodrider is bloodraging, this feral mount gains a +1 morale {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} on {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack{/g} and {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage rolls{/g}.
4f72da26-b89d-4b88-a6c3-fa0733df9758: At 6th level, a greenrager's magic unlocks the secrets of summoning allies from nature. He adds {g|SpellsSummonNaturesAllyI}summon nature's ally I{/g} to his list of 1st-level bloodrager {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spells{/g} known as a bonus spell, as if it were a bonus bloodrager spell. At 7th level, he adds {g|SpellsSummonNaturesAllyII}summon nature's ally II{/g} as a bonus 2nd-level bloodrager spell, at 10th level he adds {g|SpellsSummonNaturesAllyIII}summon nature's ally III{/g} as a bonus 3rd level bloodrager spell, and at 13th level he adds {g|SpellsSummonNaturesAllyIV}summon nature's ally IV{/g} as a bonus 4th-level bloodrager spell.
ea102d9d-7796-4b18-9106-149268aa88f7: At 7th level, a bloodrager gains {g|Encyclopedia:Damage_Reduction}damage reduction{/g}. Subtract 1 from the {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} the bloodrager takes each time he is dealt damage from a weapon or a {g|Encyclopedia:NaturalAttack}natural attack{/g}. At 10th level, and every 3 levels thereafter, this damage reduction increases by 1 point. Damage Reduction can reduce damage to 0, but not below 0.
f00a9f4f-601a-439f-8df7-3fc4753c5d78: At 7th level, a hag-riven's scarred flesh becomes thick and leathery. She gains a +1 natural armor {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} to {g|Encyclopedia:Armor_Class}AC{/g}. At 10th, 13th, 16th, and 19th levels, this bonus increases by 1.
c49b859a-fc0c-40b7-af78-831438bc0467: At 7th level, a reformed fiend gains {g|Encyclopedia:Damage_Reduction}DR{/g} 3/{g|Encyclopedia:Alignment}evil{/g}. At 10th level, and every 3 levels thereafter, this damage reduction increases by 3 points. Damage Reduction can reduce {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} to 0, but not below 0.
56afd469-553a-41c3-b1f3-971a6a96e3ae: At 7th level, as a {g|Encyclopedia:Swift_Action}swift action{/g} a steelblood can sacrifice a bloodrager {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g} slot to gain a deflection {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} to {g|Encyclopedia:Armor_Class}AC{/g} equal to the level of the spell sacrificed. The deflection bonus lasts until the end of his next turn.
57269daf-b027-4c3e-a167-550acc7a0ab9: At 7th, 10th, 13th, and 16th levels, a bloodrager learns an additional {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g} derived from his bloodline.
0d9f4fa7-7f0e-48d7-b657-201dc5803e78: At 8th level, once per bloodrage you {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}reroll{/g} the first failed {g|Encyclopedia:Skills}skill check{/g} or {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}saving throw{/g} you just made.
760fb9e5-1f2d-4c95-a019-7e695fd24e9a: At 8th level, three times per day you can try to {g|ConditionDaze}daze{/g} an opponent in close range with a hypnotic glare as a {g|Encyclopedia:Swift_Action}swift action{/g}. The target gets a {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}Will save{/g} to resist the effect ({g|Encyclopedia:DC}DC{/g} 10 + half bloodrager level + {g|Encyclopedia:Charisma}Charisma{/g} modifier). This is a mind-affecting gaze effect.
4b2e2791-9215-4621-9b78-2e4747b95234: At 8th level, when entering a bloodrage, you can choose to apply the effects of either {g|SpellsDisplacement}displacement{/g} or {g|SpellsHaste}haste{/g} to yourself. This is in addition to arcane bloodrage, and otherwise works as that ability.
d4264596-d394-4c0c-8b39-3db98d2b8b68: At 8th level, you become a blur of motion when you move. As long as you move at least 10 feet, you gain the effects of the {g|SpellsBlur}blur{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g} for 1 {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}round{/g}.
8524155d-522c-40e9-8fff-8af5e70b4d1d: At 8th level, you gain a +4 {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} on {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}saving throws{/g} against enchantment and fear effects.
de99d9bd-9255-4d24-acf7-b77887c9c9d8: At 8th level, you gain a breath weapon that you can use once per day. This breath weapon deals {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d6{/g} points of {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} of your energy type per bloodrager level. Those caught in the area of the breath can attempt a {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}Reflex saving throw{/g} for half damage. The {g|Encyclopedia:DC}DC{/g} of this save is equal to 10 + half your bloodrager level + your {g|Encyclopedia:Constitution}Constitution{/g} modifier. The shape of the breath weapon depends on your dragon type. At 16th level, you can use this ability twice per day. At 20th level, you can use this ability three times per day.
5a18271c-e256-4e66-aa17-77e7ed84f855: At 8th level, you gain cold {g|Encyclopedia:Energy_Resistance}resistance{/g} and negative energy resistance 10.
1db84077-c28c-43bc-a6da-cea1f6d592ff: At 8th level, you gain {g|Encyclopedia:Energy_Resistance}resistance{/g} 5 to acid, cold, and fire. At 16th level, these resistances increase to 10.
3f058a64-ca27-4963-92e3-4c3f8e205112: At 8th level, your base {g|Encyclopedia:Speed}speed{/g} increases by 10 feet, and you gain +2 {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} on {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}saving throws{/g} against {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spells{/g} and abilities with your elemental {g|Encyclopedia:Spell_Descriptor}descriptor{/g}.
cb0aff62-898c-4c01-9c4b-1f2dbb156fc4: At 9th level, creatures summoned by the greenrager's summon nature's ally {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g} gain a +4 morale {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} to {g|Encyclopedia:Strength}Strength{/g} and {g|Encyclopedia:Constitution}Constitution{/g} and gain the druid's woodland stride ability. At 11th level, this bonus increases to +6. At 20th level, it increases to +8.
a372ae2b-a5ef-4850-98e6-8ffbf478cc81:
At some point in your family's history, a dragon interbred with your bloodline. Now, the sublime monster's ancient power fuels your bloodrage. The power of dragons flows through you and manifests in a number of ways.
Bonus {g|Encyclopedia:Feat}Feats{/g}: Blind Fight, Cleave, Great Fortitude, Improved Initiative, Power Attack, Intimidating Prowess, Toughness.
Bonus {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}Spells{/g}: {g|SpellsShield}Shield{/g} (7th), {g|SpellsResistEnergy}resist energy{/g} (10th), {g|SpellsHeroism}heroism{/g} (13th), {g|SpellsFear}fear{/g} (16th).
6a47b27c-cf57-4799-8fa4-25e01d782e87:
Bite; {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}Save{/g}: Fortitude
Frequency: 1/{g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}round{/g} for 4 rounds
Effect: 1 {g|Encyclopedia:Constitution}Constitution{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:AbilityDamage}damage{/g}
Cure: 1 consecutive save
The save {g|Encyclopedia:DC}DC{/g} is Constitution-based.
3b77a674-fc35-41f7-b2c5-6781b4bb7434:
Bite; {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}Save{/g}: Fortitude
Frequency: 1/{g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}round{/g} for 5 rounds
Effect: 1d2 {g|Encyclopedia:Constitution}Constitution{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:AbilityDamage}damage{/g}
Cure: 1 consecutive save
The save {g|Encyclopedia:DC}DC{/g} is Constitution-based.
233c9c7d-9e2d-47d1-a722-e754698a12f2:
Bite; {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}Save{/g}: Fortitude
Frequency: 1/{g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}round{/g} for 6 rounds
Effect: {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d3{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Constitution}Constitution{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:AbilityDamage}damage{/g}
Cure: 2 consecutive saves
The save {g|Encyclopedia:DC}DC{/g} is Constitution-based.
745a6cf0-c956-4f2c-8de9-ea2e544adea8: Bloodragers are berserkers who succumb to rage to increase their power in melee fight. They can use a basic set of arcane spells, mostly to empower themselves. As a bloodrager advances, they gain immunity to certain enemies' tactical advantages.
10759fb2-a325-4194-b812-73d009f0dd66: Bloodragers are proficient with all simple and {g|Encyclopedia:Weapon_Proficiency}martial weapons{/g}, light armor, medium armor, and shields (except tower shields). A bloodrager can cast bloodrager {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spells{/g} while wearing light armor or medium armor without incurring the normal {g|Encyclopedia:Spell_Fail_Chance}arcane spell failure chance{/g}. This does not affect the arcane spell failure chance for arcane spells received from other classes. Like other arcane spellcasters, a bloodrager wearing heavy armor or wielding a shield incurs a chance of arcane spell failure if the spell in question has somatic components.
d3869158-c0cd-48d3-9f98-254297db093d: Bonus {g|Encyclopedia:Feat}Feats{/g}: Blind Fight, Cleave, Great Fortitude, Improved Initiative, Power Attack, Intimidating Prowess, Toughness.
e45a8672-d5d0-422f-a536-1a45b99f6ed7: Bonus {g|Encyclopedia:Feat}Feats{/g}: Blind Fight, Combat Reflexes, Deceitful, Improved Disarm, Improved Sunder, Intimidating Prowess, Iron Will.
00153943-967e-45ce-856b-764c4d0ba89c: Bonus {g|Encyclopedia:Feat}Feats{/g}: Blind Fight, Improved Blind Fight, Greater Blind Fight, Deceitful, Great Fortitude, Intimidating Prowess, Improved Great Fortitude.
7072b6c7-883e-406b-b1db-733f37e17fae: Bonus {g|Encyclopedia:Feat}Feats{/g}: Cleave, Dodge, Great Fortitude, Improved Initiative, Lightning Reflexes, Power Attack, Weapon Focus.
f652c513-4cdd-40f1-9827-ef158a4dd3a7: Bonus {g|Encyclopedia:Feat}Feats{/g}: Cleave, Great Fortitude, Bull Rush, Sunder, Intimidating Prowess, Power Attack, Toughness.
10821f04-2d35-4944-ae30-b39629b76cab: Bonus {g|Encyclopedia:Feat}Feats{/g}: Combat Casting, Combat Reflexes, Deceitful, Lightning Reflexes, Improved Trip, Combat Expertise, Toughness.
5292882e-ac98-4157-9da9-33c019d6ae82: Bonus {g|Encyclopedia:Feat}Feats{/g}: Combat Reflexes, Disruptive, Improved Initiative, Iron Will, Power Attack, Combat Casting, Arcane Strike.
b0b7e1bb-e12f-4ed9-977d-b9e968daa836: Bonus {g|Encyclopedia:Feat}Feats{/g}: Combat Reflexes, Dodge, Improved Initiative, Lightning Reflexes, Mobility, Improved Lightning Reflexes, Intimidating Prowess.
ffcd48a9-dcfa-4080-937c-a2886eac9b0a: Bonus {g|Encyclopedia:Feat}Feats{/g}: Diehard, Dodge, Endurance, Intimidating Prowess, Iron Will, Mobility, Toughness.
84ff1f65-e9f4-4475-81ce-9db34ae826bc: Bonus {g|Encyclopedia:Feat}Feats{/g}: Dodge, Improved Initiative, Iron Will, Mobility, Toughness, Weapon Focus.
d18103e2-ff77-4c4d-abd6-5d912876925c:
Breath Weapon: 40-foot cone of acid.
Resistance: acid 20.
f1e2fd71-bb3a-4b8e-98b9-500ed5dec36e:
Breath Weapon: 40-foot cone of cold.
Resistance: cold 20.
fe19f55c-c810-414d-b508-e1802f1c7072:
Breath Weapon: 40-foot cone of cold.
Resistance: cold 20.
2b1852f9-cae2-475b-8f0b-c6588b1907dd:
Breath Weapon: 40-foot cone of fire.
Resistance: fire 20.
d1b573f2-1df3-4ff8-afee-2389a24b36cc:
Breath Weapon: 40-foot cone of fire.
Resistance: fire 20.
c97c589d-cd96-4704-9fc2-2f9b77150888:
Breath Weapon: 80-foot line of acid.
Resistance: acid 20.
026381a4-b505-4d7b-97be-85ab09e2f16a:
Breath Weapon: 80-foot line of electricity.
Resistance: electricity 20.
6d161ff3-2743-4e02-81c1-59bf9483caa5:
Breath Weapon: 80-foot line of electricity.
Resistance: electricity 20.
0dbb0abf-766b-4290-8895-072eb4041b25:
Breath Weapon: 80-foot line of fire.
Resistance: fire 20.
960648cd-82f0-4b73-88c6-885b15bd9450:
By way of a celestial ancestor or divine intervention, the blood of angels fills your body with a holy potency, granting you a majestic visage and angelic powers when you enter your bloodrage.
Your bloodline grants a number of resistances and changes your form to something angelic and terrible to behold when you bloodrage.
Bonus {g|Encyclopedia:Feat}Feats{/g}: Dodge, Improved Initiative, Iron Will, Mobility, Toughness, Weapon Focus.
Bonus {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}Spells{/g}: {g|SpellsBless}Bless{/g} (7th), {g|SpellsResistEnergy}resist energy{/g} (10th), {g|SpellsHeroism}heroism{/g} (13th), {g|SpellsCrusadersEdge}crusader's edge{/g} (16th).
0cd6f34d-4ecc-467a-a444-fd248d65db4c: Change bloodline power for two rage powers
3e88b891-eb4a-48a0-a21b-fd41881da322: Corrosive weapon deals an extra {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d6{/g} points of {g|Encyclopedia:Energy_Damage}acid damage{/g} on a successful hit.
f1af656d-5431-4738-8da5-18bd4ef8651a:
Doesn't have the following feature: Bloodline
					or
Has a bloodline of the same type granted by another class
77f78ae3-0ad0-4693-ac9a-1e3cc737516c: Each bloodrager descends from someone who possessed innate magic — dragons, fey, devils, etc. Bloodline gives them a number of {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spells{/g}, {g|Encyclopedia:Feat}feats{/g} and unique abilities to choose from, and allows them to specialize in a particular style of combat.
98fb104b-d089-48f5-9247-e0a9393c7134:
Each bloodrager has a source of magic somewhere in his heritage that empowers his bloodrages, bonus {g|Encyclopedia:Feat}feats{/g}, and bonus {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spells{/g}. Sometimes this source reflects a distant blood relationship to a powerful being, or is due to an extreme event involving such a creature somewhere in his family's past. Regardless of the source, this influence manifests in a number of ways. A bloodrager must pick one bloodline upon taking his first level of bloodrager. Once made, this choice cannot be changed.
The bloodrager gains bloodline powers at 1st level, 4th level, and every 4 levels thereafter. The bloodline powers a bloodrager gains are described in his chosen bloodline. For all spell-like bloodline powers, treat the character's bloodrager level as the {g|Encyclopedia:Caster_Level}caster level{/g}.
At 6th level and every 3 levels thereafter, a bloodrager receives one bonus feat chosen from a list specific to each bloodline. The bloodrager must meet the prerequisites for these bonus feats. At 7th, 10th, 13th, and 16th levels, a bloodrager learns an additional spell derived from his bloodline.
If the bloodrager takes levels in another class that grants a bloodline, the bloodlines must be the same type.
3f408002-cbe3-4059-8a1f-d3a9fd6fc873: Flaming weapon is sheathed in fire that deals an extra {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d6{/g} points of {g|Encyclopedia:Energy_Damage}fire damage{/g} on a successful hit.
bfe05e7e-3175-4750-9d2d-6b0cd64a4d8f: Frost weapon is sheathed in a terrible, icy cold that deals an extra {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d6{/g} points of {g|Encyclopedia:Energy_Damage}cold damage{/g} on a successful hit.
f6638d61-7997-4dd1-aa5b-bbc425584f80:
Generations ago, a demon spread its filth into the essence of your bloodline. While it doesn't manifest in all of your kin, in those moments when you're bloodraging, you embody its terrifying presence.
The power of the Abyss courses through your veins, causing horrific transformations during your bloodrage.
Bonus {g|Encyclopedia:Feat}Feats{/g}: Cleave, Great Fortitude, Improved Bull Rush, Improved Sunder, Intimidating Prowess, Power Attack, Toughness.
Bonus {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}Spells{/g}: {g|SpellsRayOfEnfeeblement}Ray of enfeeblement{/g} (7th), {g|SpellsBullsStrength}bull's strength{/g} (10th), {g|SpellsRage}rage{/g} (13th), {g|SpellsStoneskin}stoneskin{/g} (16th).
991da82f-03bd-48e8-ac27-d0b6745748ef:
Hags interbreed with other races frequently, and those children who escape their grasp may pass their heritage on to later generations before it reemerges. The potent humors that accompany hag blood are better suited to a bloodrager's ferocity than to traditional spellcasting. While bloodraging, you manifest the physical power and arcane corruption of your hag ancestor.
Bonus {g|Encyclopedia:Feat}Feats{/g}: Blind Fight, Improved Blind Fight, Greater Blind Fight, Deceitful, Great Fortitude, Intimidating Prowess, Improved Great Fortitude.
Bonus {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}Spells{/g}: {g|SpellsCorrosiveTouch}Corrosive touch{/g} (7th), {g|SpellsBlindness}blindness{/g} (10th), {g|SpellsBestowCurse}bestow curse{/g} (13th), {g|SpellsDominateMonster}dominate monster{/g} (16th).
4defac02-bcf2-4083-9e12-677f4b432702: In the world's wild lands, a mount is an advantage in both everyday life and the dealing of death. In many barbarian tribes, the true stature of a warrior is determined by his skill and ferocity on horseback. Other tribes measure it in skill atop whatever terrible mounts their people employ. A number of bloodragers are not only skilled in the art of mounted combat, but have learned to channel their arcane energies directly into their mount.
2a9dd7bd-bd2e-43ca-8867-97890addab88: Most bloodragers prefer light armor, but some learn the secret of using heavy armors. These steelbloods plod around the battlefield inspiring fear and delivering carnage from within a steel shell.
e13027cb-142b-4105-a9bf-a58697be7a82:
One of your ancestors was fey, or the fey realm somehow intermixed with your bloodline. It affects your bloodrage in tricky and surprising ways.
The power of the natural world saturates your being, and manifests itself when you bloodrage.
Bonus {g|Encyclopedia:Feat}Feats{/g}: Combat Reflexes, Dodge, Improved Initiative, Lightning Reflexes, Mobility, Improved Lightning Reflexes, Intimidating Prowess.
Bonus {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}Spells{/g}: {g|SpellsEntangle}Entangle{/g} (7th), {g|SpellsHideousLaughter}hideous laughter{/g} (10th), {g|SpellsHaste}haste{/g} (13th), {g|SpellsConfusion}confusion{/g} (16th).
2e8c7363-6a84-4740-a451-d3600a711c78: Shock weapon is sheathed in crackling electricity that deals an extra {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d6{/g} points of {g|Encyclopedia:Energy_Damage}electricity damage{/g} on a successful hit.
a090f7dc-9e5d-4817-87bc-393ec4bb5ef3: Sometimes, mixed blood makes a bloodrager into an unstoppable martial machine, forcing conflicting impulses on his mind.
1e7dfde2-aa75-48af-b2e8-478b24126f38: Starting at 4th level, a mixed-blood rager can choose a second bloodline to invoke at the same time.
eb2c62b8-c5d3-4852-9b58-690e9552a1e9:
The Pit lives in your blood. Maybe one of your ancestors was seduced by the powers of Hell or made a deal with a devil. Either way, its corruption seethes within your lineage.
When you bloodrage, hellfire infuses your blood with terrifying effects.
Bonus {g|Encyclopedia:Feat}Feats{/g}: Blind Fight, Combat Reflexes, Deceitful, Improved Disarm, Improved Sunder, Intimidating Prowess, Iron Will.
Bonus {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}Spells{/g}: {g|SpellsProtectionFromGood}Protection from good{/g} (7th), {g|SpellsScorchingRay}scorching ray{/g} (10th), {g|SpellsFireball}fireball{/g} (13th), {g|SpellsShout}shout{/g} (16th).
4845b599-5480-44b8-8c2c-84c11c09b44a:
The bloodrager's source of internal power grants him the ability to bloodrage.
At 1st level, a bloodrager can bloodrage for a number of {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}rounds{/g} per day equal to 4 + his {g|Encyclopedia:Constitution}Constitution{/g} modifier. At each level after 1st, he can bloodrage for 2 additional rounds per day. Temporary increases to Constitution (such as those gained from bloodraging or {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spells{/g} like {g|SpellsBearsEndurance}bear's endurance{/g}) don't increase the total number of rounds that a bloodrager can bloodrage per day. The total number of rounds of bloodrage per day is renewed after {g|Encyclopedia:Rest}resting{/g} for 8 hours, although these hours need not be consecutive.
While in a bloodrage, a bloodrager gains a +2 {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} on {g|Encyclopedia:MeleeAttack}melee attack{/g} rolls, melee {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage rolls{/g}, thrown weapon damage rolls, and {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}Will saving throws{/g}. In addition, he takes a -2 {g|Encyclopedia:Penalty}penalty{/g} to {g|Encyclopedia:Armor_Class}Armor Class{/g}. He also gains 2 temporary {g|Encyclopedia:HP}hit points{/g} per {g|Encyclopedia:Hit_Dice}Hit Die{/g}. These temporary hit points are lost first when a character takes damage, disappear when the bloodrage ends, and are not replenished if the bloodrager enters a bloodrage again within 1 minute of his previous bloodrage.
If a bloodrager falls {g|Encyclopedia:Injury_Death}unconscious{/g}, his bloodrage immediately ends, placing him in peril of death.
Bloodrage counts as the barbarian's rage class feature for the purpose of {g|Encyclopedia:Feat}feat{/g} prerequisites, feat abilities, magic item abilities, and spell effects.
e8acbf46-ebc4-4903-9341-94fd0ef6ccc2: The bloodrider is adept at pushing his mount to its limit. The {g|Encyclopedia:Speed}speed{/g} of any mount the bloodrager rides increases by 10 feet.
a75bef4f-9e31-4a54-90b1-1f48782854cb:
The foul corruption of undeath is a part of you. Somewhere in the past, death became infused with your lineage. Your connection to the attributes of the undead bestows frightening power when your bloodrage.
When you enter a bloodrage, the powers of undeath manifest, empowering your {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attacks{/g} with fear and your body with foul resistances.
Bonus {g|Encyclopedia:Feat}Feats{/g}: Diehard, Dodge, Endurance, Intimidating Prowess, Iron Will, Mobility, Toughness.
Bonus {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}Spells{/g}: {g|SpellsSnowball}Snowball{/g} (7th), {g|SpellsFalseLife}false life{/g} (10th), {g|SpellsVampiricTouch}vampiric touch{/g} (13th), {g|SpellsEnervation}enervation{/g} (16th).
2c90a26a-c3b0-4bca-bd51-49223e47ebcb: The painful rituals that create a hag-riven can work for any creatures tenacious enough to endure them. Those who survive without transforming into hags are scarred and saturated in arcane power.
2b11d5f8-6756-4099-8227-caeadfa24eba:
The power of the elements resides in you, and at times you can hardly control its fury. This influence comes either from an elemental outsider in your family history or from a moment when you or your ancestors were exposed to a powerful elemental force or cataclysm.
One of the four elements infuses your being, and you can draw upon its power while bloodraging. A number of your abilities deal {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} and grant resistances based on your element.
Bonus {g|Encyclopedia:Feat}Feats{/g}: Cleave, Dodge, Great Fortitude, Improved Initiative, Lightning Reflexes, Power Attack, Weapon Focus.
Bonus {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}Spells{/g}: {g|SpellsBurningHands}Burning hands{/g}* (7th), {g|SpellsScorchingRay}scorching ray{/g}* (10th), {g|SpellsProtectionFromEnergy}protection from energy{/g} (13th), {g|SpellsElementalBodyI}elemental body I{/g} (16th). (Spells marked with an asterisk [*] always deal a type of {g|Encyclopedia:Energy_Damage}energy damage{/g} determined by your element, regardless of the spell's normal effects. In addition, the subtype of these spells changes to match the energy type of your element.)
07cff54e-21d5-4cef-998a-86559759a197: The teachings of light gods say that everyone deserves the right to redemption. Everyone – except the demons. Reformed fiends are demons who have entered on the path of good, although they still look like monsters in the eyes of the most living. But no one will dare to doubt that the rage with which they fight the creatures of evil is the force that the world needs most in these difficult times.
40f84176-ce40-402e-8626-1ca233ba09d4: This ability temporarily increases the {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack{/g} power, {g|Encyclopedia:HP}health{/g} and the ability to resist hostile control, but also decreases defense. After the rage ends, the character gets {g|ConditionFatigued}fatigued{/g} and becomes weaker for a short time.
bd57fe3b-ffb0-4792-9f1d-42062f028195: This {g|Encyclopedia:Special_Abilities}special ability{/g} can only be placed on melee weapons. A nullifying weapon suppresses a creature's {g|Encyclopedia:Spell_Resistance}spell resistance{/g} for a short amount of time. Anytime the weapon strikes a creature with spell resistance, the target's spell resistance is reduced by 1 for 1 minute. On a confirmed {g|Encyclopedia:Critical}critical hit{/g}, its spell resistance is instead reduced by 2. Multiple hits from a nullifying weapon stack.
c37c3b6f-eb95-49b5-94d7-8491dd89d863: Typically, nature finds its greatest harmony with divine magic, but sometimes a connection with the natural world manifest itself through the arcane current in the veins of the bloodragers called greenragers. These bloodragers funnel their eldritch heritage into abilities that allow them to call powerful allies from nature and empower them with their bloodrage.
2e1358e8-457a-4af1-bc43-81060dc99c8d: When a vicious weapon strikes an opponent, it creates a flash of disruptive energy that resonates between the opponent and the wielder. This energy deals an extra {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}2d6{/g} points of {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} to the opponent and 1d6 points of damage to the wielder.
36e3212d-bc39-4e53-94a8-cd4e443bbffe: When making a full {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack{/g}, the wielder of a speed weapon may make one extra attack with it. The attack uses the wielder's full {g|Encyclopedia:BAB}base attack bonus{/g}, plus any modifiers appropriate to the situation. (This benefit is not cumulative with similar effects, such as a {g|SpellsHaste}Haste{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g}.)
1a42f4cd-aa13-4a62-bea4-5842bdfc5066:
When you bloodrage, serpentine nature infuses you with vicious grace.
Bonus {g|Encyclopedia:Feat}Feats{/g}: Combat Casting, Combat Reflexes, Deceitful, Lightning Reflexes, Improved Trip, Combat Expertise, Toughness.
Bonus {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}Spells{/g}: {g|SpellsExpeditiousRetreat}Expeditious retreat{/g} (7th), {g|SpellsCatsGrace}cat's grace{/g} (10th), {g|SpellsHoldPerson}hold person{/g} (13th), {g|SpellsTouchOfSlime}touch of slime{/g} (16th).
abad6dbd-d78f-4738-8880-bb8c710f3387: Where other bloodragers learn to avoid or shrug off minor damage of all sorts, spelleaters tap into the power of their bloodline in order to heal damage as it comes, and can even cannibalize their own magical energy to heal more damage and continue taking the fight to the enemy.
f21dcfa9-224b-4d07-9824-ebd6ccac6f8a: While bloodrage powers come from the very essence of a bloodrager's being and are often strict and immutable, some bloodragers tap into ancient traditions and primitive wisdom to enhance their rages with something more primal. The primalist mixes his bloodline with more traditional rage powers.
8f76d282-cfa3-4a03-ae7d-64e96eb791c0: While in bloodrage, a bloodrager gains a +2 {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} on {g|Encyclopedia:MeleeAttack}melee attack{/g} rolls, melee {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage rolls{/g}, thrown weapon damage rolls, and {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}Will saving throws{/g}. In addition, she takes a -2 {g|Encyclopedia:Penalty}penalty{/g} to {g|Encyclopedia:Armor_Class}Armor Class{/g}. She also gains 2 temporary {g|Encyclopedia:HP}hit points{/g} per {g|Encyclopedia:Hit_Dice}Hit Die{/g}.
fdc47e13-37d4-4b9c-a8cc-f9b97f398639: While many ferocious combatants can tap into a deep reservoir of buried rage, bloodragers have an intrinsic power that seethes within. Like sorcerers, bloodragers' veins surge with arcane power. While sorcerers use this power for spellcasting, bloodragers enter an altered state in which their bloodline becomes manifest, where the echoes of their strange ancestry lash out with devastating power. In these states, bloodragers can cast some arcane spells instinctively. The bloodrager's magic is as fast, violent, and seemingly unstoppable as their physical prowess.
4d98d296-039c-449b-9c28-b9b211e10d10:
While others of your kin may be powerful wizards and sorcerers, the eldritch nature of the blood coursing through your veins transforms you into a {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g}-breaking terror.
When you bloodrage, arcane power transforms you into an arcane juggernaut who can cut down even the most careful caster.
Bonus {g|Encyclopedia:Feat}Feats{/g}: Combat Reflexes, Disruptive, Improved Initiative, Iron Will, Power Attack, Combat Casting, Arcane Strike.
Bonus Spells: {g|SpellsMagicMissile}Magic missile{/g} (7th), {g|SpellsInvisibility}invisibility{/g} (10th), {g|SpellsLightningBolt}lightning bolt{/g} (13th), {g|SpellsDimensionDoor}dimension door{/g} (16th).
e3768984-2f44-4e37-bbac-82e051eab22a: You are trained in the art of causing pain. You receive a +4 circumstance {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} on {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack rolls{/g} made to confirm {g|Encyclopedia:Critical}critical hits{/g}.
07ff88a7-9471-4673-88f6-823a0f52462c: You imbue your {g|Encyclopedia:MeleeAttack}melee attacks{/g} with elemental energy. For 1 {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}round{/g}, your melee attacks deal {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d6{/g} points of additional {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} of your energy type.
caaf6e20-f221-42a4-9423-c1b07cc7b67d: Your {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spellcasting{/g} is obstructed. To cast a spell, you need to make a {g|Encyclopedia:Concentration}concentration check{/g} with 15 + double spell level {g|Encyclopedia:DC}difficulty{/g}.
